trans-unit.source: Test Plan Setup on Items

seg-source.mrk: Test Plan Setup on Items

trans-unit.source: The Item Test Order Option, Sampling Method and Inspection Severity Code can be allocated to the respective item in the Test Plan Setup page, which is accessed from the ribbon on the Item Card.

seg-source.mrk: The Item Test Order Option, Sampling Method and Inspection Severity Code can be allocated to the respective item in the Test Plan Setup page, which is accessed from the ribbon on the Item Card.

trans-unit.source: : Test Plan Setup for item Q-20001

seg-source.mrk: : Test Plan Setup for item Q-20001

trans-unit.source: In this page, assign test plans to different Source Types (such as Purchase Orders, Production Order and so on) item (group) specifically. Furthermore, this page offers the opportunity to enter customer-specific or vendor-specific test plans.

seg-source.mrk: In this page, assign test plans to different Source Types (such as Purchase Orders, Production Order and so on) item (group) specifically.
Furthermore, this page offers the opportunity to enter customer-specific or vendor-specific test plans.

trans-unit.source: The fields in the header of this page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the header of this page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Source Type Filter

seg-source.mrk: Source Type Filter

trans-unit.source: Source type to allocate the test plan to. The options are Inventory, Purchase Order, Purchase Receipt, Sales Order, Sales Return Order, Sales Return Receipt, Production Order, Operation, None, Order-specific and Component.

seg-source.mrk: Source type to allocate the test plan to.
The options are Inventory, Purchase Order, Purchase Receipt, Sales Order, Sales Return Order, Sales Return Receipt, Production Order, Operation, None, Order-specific and Component.

trans-unit.source: Source No. Filter

seg-source.mrk: Source No.
Filter

trans-unit.source: Number of the source type selected in the Source Type Filter field.

seg-source.mrk: Number of the source type selected in the Source Type Filter field.

trans-unit.source: Item No. Filter

seg-source.mrk: Item No.
Filter

trans-unit.source: Item to be affected by these settings.

seg-source.mrk: Item to be affected by these settings.

trans-unit.source: Item Category Filter

seg-source.mrk: Item Category Filter

trans-unit.source: Item category to be affected by these settings.

seg-source.mrk: Item category to be affected by these settings.

trans-unit.source: The fields in the lines are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the lines are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Item Test Order Option

seg-source.mrk: Item Test Order Option

trans-unit.source: Defines the level on which an item should be tested. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Defines the level on which an item should be tested.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: No Test – no test orders are created.

seg-source.mrk: No Test – no test orders are created.

trans-unit.source: Test on Item Level – a single test order is created for the item, regardless of lot- or serial numbers.

seg-source.mrk: Test on Item Level – a single test order is created for the item, regardless of lot- or serial numbers.

trans-unit.source: Test on Lot No. Trading Unit – a test order is created for each lot number.

seg-source.mrk: Test on Lot No.
Trading Unit – a test order is created for each lot number.

trans-unit.source: Test on Serial No. – a test order is created for each serial number.

seg-source.mrk: Test on Serial No.
– a test order is created for each serial number.

trans-unit.source: Test on Trading Unit – a test order is created for each trading unit of a lot.

seg-source.mrk: Test on Trading Unit – a test order is created for each trading unit of a lot.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a user posts a Receipt with two lots (Lot A and Lot B) the following tests are created, based on the Item Test Order Option:

seg-source.mrk: For example, if a user posts a Receipt with two lots (Lot A and Lot B) the following tests are created, based on the Item Test Order Option:

trans-unit.source: Test on Item Level:

seg-source.mrk: Test on Item Level:

trans-unit.source: One Test Order – Item No. is populated in the General FastTab; lot information is empty on the Test Plan Source FastTab

seg-source.mrk: One Test Order – Item No.
is populated in the General FastTab; lot information is empty on the Test Plan Source FastTab

trans-unit.source: Test on Lot No. Trading Unit:

seg-source.mrk: Test on Lot No.
Trading Unit:

trans-unit.source: Two Test Orders (one for each lot) – Item No. and Lot No. are populated

seg-source.mrk: Two Test Orders (one for each lot) – Item No.
and Lot No.
are populated

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: In cc|process manufacturing, trading units are an integral part of the storage unit functionality. Therefore, the “Test on Lot No.” option was renamed to “Test on Lot No. Trading Unit” to accommodate the integration of cc|quality management with cc|process manufacturing.

seg-source.mrk: In cc|process manufacturing, trading units are an integral part of the storage unit functionality.
Therefore, the “Test on Lot No.” option was renamed to “Test on Lot No.
Trading Unit” to accommodate the integration of cc|quality management with cc|process manufacturing.

trans-unit.source: Sampling Method

seg-source.mrk: Sampling Method

trans-unit.source: Defines for the item if the sampling method according to Oeser/Strohecker or DIN ISO 2859 should be applied.

seg-source.mrk: Defines for the item if the sampling method according to Oeser/Strohecker or DIN ISO 2859 should be applied.

trans-unit.source: If the DIN ISO 2859 option is selected, the Inspection Severity Code and Sampling Method fields must be filled with the ISO2859 or DIN2859 values. In this case, the system will apply an acceptance sample testing based on faulty parts or errors.

seg-source.mrk: If the DIN ISO 2859 option is selected, the Inspection Severity Code and Sampling Method fields must be filled with the ISO2859 or DIN2859 values.
In this case, the system will apply an acceptance sample testing based on faulty parts or errors.

trans-unit.source: Inspection Severity Code

seg-source.mrk: Inspection Severity Code

trans-unit.source: Required if the DIN ISO 2859 option is selected in the Sampling Method field.

seg-source.mrk: Required if the DIN ISO 2859 option is selected in the Sampling Method field.

trans-unit.source: Insp. Severity on Test Prop.

seg-source.mrk: Insp.
Severity on Test Prop.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether an inspection severity has been assigned to a test property (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref441486560" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Inspection Severities of Test Properties” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether an inspection severity has been assigned to a test property (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref441486560" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Inspection Severities of Test Properties” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Inspection Level

seg-source.mrk: Inspection Level

trans-unit.source: Indicates the Inspection Level for counting (AQL) to be used for testing; if this field is empty, Inspection Level II is used.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the Inspection Level for counting (AQL) to be used for testing; if this field is empty, Inspection Level II is used.

trans-unit.source: Test Plan No.

seg-source.mrk: Test Plan No.

trans-unit.source: Number of the test plan that should be allocated to the item depending on the source type.

seg-source.mrk: Number of the test plan that should be allocated to the item depending on the source type.

trans-unit.source: Adjust Lot Status on Test

seg-source.mrk: Adjust Lot Status on Test

trans-unit.source: If selected, the lot status will automatically be set to:

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the lot status will automatically be set to:

trans-unit.source: The value in the Lot-/Serial No.-Status on Test Order Release field in the Quality Management Setup page when a test order is Released.

seg-source.mrk: The value in the Lot-/Serial No.-Status on Test Order Release field in the Quality Management Setup page when a test order is Released.

trans-unit.source: The value in the Lot-/Serial No.-Status on Test Order Finish field in the Quality Management Setup page when a test order is Finished.

seg-source.mrk: The value in the Lot-/Serial No.-Status on Test Order Finish field in the Quality Management Setup page when a test order is Finished.

trans-unit.source: No Test Order on Subcontr.

seg-source.mrk: No Test Order on Subcontr.

trans-unit.source: If selected, prevents duplicate testing requirements when creating a Purchase Order for a Production Order line, which may already contain Test Plan Setup (Source Type = Purchase Receipt) for the subcontracting order.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, prevents duplicate testing requirements when creating a Purchase Order for a Production Order line, which may already contain Test Plan Setup (Source Type = Purchase Receipt) for the subcontracting order.

trans-unit.source: Test Wait Time

seg-source.mrk: Test Wait Time

trans-unit.source: Indicates the time needed to start testing, beginning from the Test Order creation. For example, it may define offset time to start testing after goods receipt posting. The Wait Time Unit of Meas. Code field is required to specify this time.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the time needed to start testing, beginning from the Test Order creation.
For example, it may define offset time to start testing after goods receipt posting.
The <span class="Bold">Wait Time Unit of Meas.
Code field is required to specify this time.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Order Scheduling.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Order Scheduling” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Order Scheduling.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Order Scheduling” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Wait Time Unit of Meas. Code

seg-source.mrk: Wait Time Unit of Meas.
Code

trans-unit.source: Used with the Test Wait Time field to complete the time specification. Codes of Capacity Units of Measure (from manufacturing) can be assigned here.

seg-source.mrk: Used with the Test Wait Time field to complete the time specification.
Codes of Capacity Units of Measure (from manufacturing) can be assigned here.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Order Scheduling.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Order Scheduling” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Test Order Scheduling.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Order Scheduling” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Copy Item Test Plan Setup

seg-source.mrk: Copy Item Test Plan Setup

trans-unit.source: Existing Test Plan Setup records can be copied from a selected item to a selection of one or more items. This can be used from the Item Test Plan Setup or the Periodic Activities on the cc|quality management menu and provides the ability to copy the Test Plan Setup for a specific Source Type or for all existing Source Types of the “Template” Item.

seg-source.mrk: Existing Test Plan Setup records can be copied from a selected item to a selection of one or more items.

This can be used from the Item Test Plan Setup or the Periodic Activities on the cc|quality management menu and provides the ability to copy the Test Plan Setup for a specific Source Type or for all existing Source Types of the “Template” Item.

trans-unit.source: : Preparing to copy all Test Plan Setup from item Q-40014 to item Q-40013

seg-source.mrk: : Preparing to copy all Test Plan Setup from item Q-40014 to item Q-40013

trans-unit.source: The Template Item setup(s) can be copied to one or more items based on specific item filters in one step.

seg-source.mrk: The Template Item setup(s) can be copied to one or more items based on specific item filters in one step.

trans-unit.source: : All Test Plan Setup copied from item Q-40014 to item Q-40013

seg-source.mrk: : All Test Plan Setup copied from item Q-40014 to item Q-40013

trans-unit.source: Inspection Severities of Test Properties

seg-source.mrk: Inspection Severities of Test Properties

trans-unit.source: Different schedules can be assigned to each test property so that testing is done based on the Inspection Severities of a property as opposed to the Inspection Severity of the overall test plan.

seg-source.mrk: Different schedules can be assigned to each test property so that testing is done based on the Inspection Severities of a property as opposed to the Inspection Severity of the overall test plan.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: Properties without a specific Inspection Severity will use the one assigned to the Test Plan Setup line.

seg-source.mrk: Properties without a specific Inspection Severity will use the one assigned to the Test Plan Setup line.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon of the Test Plan Setup page, click Property Inspection Severities to open the Item Test Prop. Insp. Severities page.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon of the Test Plan Setup page, click Property Inspection Severities to open the Item Test Prop.
Insp.
Severities page.

trans-unit.source: : Inspection Severities for Test Properties

seg-source.mrk: : Inspection Severities for Test Properties

trans-unit.source: As Fig. 6 illustrates, the first line has the Test Each Used check box selected, which means that a value has been entered in the Test Each (Times) field for the test property (refer to Fig. 2), and therefore an Inspection Severity cannot be entered on this line. A different Inspection Severity Code has been entered for the last property. When the page is closed, the Insp. Severity on Test Prop. field is set to Yes on the Test Plan Setup page.

seg-source.mrk: As Fig. 6 illustrates, the first line has the Test Each Used check box selected, which means that a value has been entered in the Test Each (Times) field for the test property (refer to Fig. 2), and therefore an Inspection Severity cannot be entered on this line.
A different Inspection Severity Code has been entered for the last property.
When the page is closed, the <span class="Bold">Insp.
Severity on Test Prop.
field is set to Yes on the Test Plan Setup page.

trans-unit.source: : Test Plan Setup with Inspection Severity on a Test Property
